website_summaries.verdict: We recommend this set of 6 blades to beginning and intermediate throwers for practice sessions.
pros: Nylon sheath holds all 6 blades securely
cons: Blades must be sharpened upon arrival
Individual knives have different lengths, balance points

customer_reviews.title: Smith and Wesson throwing knives made from a high quality alloy. You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Buy these and forget garbage Throwing knives. They are impressive. The picture doesn't do Justice to these. Buy them! Addendum. For the money Smith and Wesson wins!!! These are WORTH the money. I may get another set!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Best quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knives, I've been throwing for years and decided to get a new set and these things are great. Perfectly balanced easy to throw. Great knife for beginners to
customer_reviews.author: evan b.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of knives.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set for my 11 year old grandson. They are really nice quality and well balanced. They have a good weight to them. We tied a small piece of red string through the handles to make them easy to find when they miss the target. He will be enjoying these for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cant rate trash they don't deserve 1 star !  Very Disappointed these Knives are complete trash
customer_reviews.text: 10 minutes after receiving these "Professional Quality throwing knives two tips are bent ...We have a sheet of plywood with a target on it ...wtf...this quality is trash..after examining closer they are all different in size ,shape and weight you can see by looking at these knives they are uneven. These knives are complete Trash! I expected great Quality from Smith and Wesson and got the worst I've seen
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Nice weight and feel for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight of the S&W throwing knives; have a couple of different sizes. They are hard steel and do not bend, therefore, they can be broken should they hit at a poor angle or hit an equally hard object; that is a trade-off that I can live with. I like the way these knives feel in my hand and have not concern about cutting my hands while throwing them.....and, I do throw them hard.
customer_reviews.author: T. Donahey

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Even for the low price the quality is awful. A thrower doesn't need to be razor sharp, but these haven't even been ground to an edge. Only two of the six come close to having a point! All six are of different length, weight and balance. I cannot express how much I recommend not buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Mason

customer_reviews.title: Quite fun and effective
customer_reviews.text: Is this for beginners? Oh yeah! First throw and perfection. Great weight, very durable. Excellent way to annoy the neighbor who thinks your fence line is the appropriate place to have loud phone calls (my camera security system recorded very loud echoing thuds & I heard the neighbor complain about me, maybe now they will talk inside their house and not where I can hear them in mine). Tried several throw techniques and the balance & weight is perfect for all of them. Bought as a quarantine anniversary gift and this is just perfect to get outside and release tension.
customer_reviews.author: C. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to learn how to better throw knives. they're durable, and reliable with good weight to them. me and my brother threw them for an afternoon, many bouncing off hard ground (and a few rebounded far enough to hit a nearby sidewalk) other than a few minor scratches, they're in great shape! the only caution is to watch the edges if you're new like me. they're not rounded and can catch gloves and fingers if held wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Boy Scouts
customer_reviews.text: Bought these throwing knives for our Boy Scout Troop. Our Scouts, ages 11-17 had no problem throwing these at all. Even took them to a large Scout event where hundreds of Scouts came through over the weekend and got to throw. Despite these beginner throwers often hitting hard things that were not the target, all the tips remained in good shape. No damage at all. They are well balanced and easy to throw. I did wrap a brightly colored tape around part of the handle to make them easier to find since they can get lost in grass when people miss. I like the case that these come with too. Keeps them safe and is compact.
customer_reviews.author: starfan72Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a week...
customer_reviews.text: Had two knives break just at the top of the lower notch after only a week. Not sure if these knives were just weak or what but they didn't hold up. Also all the tips bent but still went into the target. I will say I learned to throw no spin okay with these knives so they still are good for beginers
customer_reviews.author: James Cathey

customer_reviews.title: Dull and light meh
customer_reviews.text: I thought these knives were a waste of money but I was wrong. They're super well-balanced and have a really nice spin to them. They're durable and perfect for throwing outside. I retract my 1 star rating. Everyone is saying use a softer target. Softer than wood? Really. I bought a set of condor knives these are no match not even close. By the way I've been throwing steady for 3yrs and have yet to break a decent knife.
customer_reviews.author: A Mackerelote

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: I set up a little throwing range in the basement for my son. He has three sisters, and need some kind of outlet. These throwing knives have made four hours of fun, though we are still pretty terrible at throwing them. If you're looking for something that will fly out of your hand in somehow inevitably end up point first in the wood, these are not your knives. But then again, almost no knives would be your knives. However, these have held up well, they fly straight, and they tend to be at least as good at flying as I am at throwing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Decent set
customer_reviews.text: Never threw knives before and after reading the reviews this set seemed like a good sturdy set to begin with. They feel good in the hand and seem to be balanced well. They are not razor sharp but pointed enough that they stick in wood very well. I’ve thrown them into 2 x 4’s, oak, maple and pine. (Not into live trees but into stacks of firewood)
customer_reviews.author: S Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Anyway can't really recommend as they are
customer_reviews.text: These are raw blades: they've got to be grinded and sharpened to be useful. Right now my letter opener is sharper than these babies.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Great price, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just getting started with the hobby of knife throwing and I was looking for an inexpensive knife set to practice with. These fit the bill perfectly. They feel well balanced, throw well and for the price couldn't be beat. I'd definitely recommend these for anyone wanting to give knife throwing a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.

customer_reviews.title: 2 broke after some hard throws
customer_reviews.text: I am brand new to throwing knives, I started out doing rotational throwing but saw that no spin is far more effective and cool (no one believes it doesn’t rotate when you do it). I am a fairly large guy and I throw them pretty hard, I cracked one and straight up snapped another, I recommend not throwing them as hard as you can as they might break 😂. But I have learned a lot with these and I recommend them, also pro tip is to throw where there isn’t a lot of loose dirt as they can get easily buried, and paint the handles yellow or some bright color as to easily see them.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Modern Rouge; Activate!
customer_reviews.text: Okay- these are really good IF you don’t start hating them the second a tip breaks. Out of the 6 in the kit, one tip got broken while practicing, but I grabbed the knife tool and drew out a new tip- now it’s the best knife out of the 6. They’re fun to throw, comfortable, look awesome and are light. They’re tightly packed in the holster, but with practice you can draw and shoot just fine
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these knives, spend some extra money ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these knives, spend some extra money and get a quality set. Second time using these one of them broke in half!!! All five other knives remained intact that day. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Spencer GT King

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have always had an interest in learning to throw knives, and so far I have thrown each knife at least 100 times each and only broke one tip after one knife directly hit another (my mistake, not a manufacturing flaw) and one tip got dulled for the same reason. They do not come razor sharp and with their weight they do NOT need to be. With very little effort they will lodge about 1/2 an inch in a 2x4 and the tips are just fine. None show any signs of bending as they are about 4 millimetres thick and that would be tough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Wow batman
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I have some throwing knives but these are THROWING KNIVES. Heavy, and I mean heavy. Durable. Strong. Beautifully crafted. My only grief is they are not remotely sharp. Yes, the have a point and that point would do damage, but they could have provided some level of sharpness. Maybe I am wrong but my other throwing knives can slice and dice too. Anyway, shockingly heavy but worth every dime you spend. Get em already.
customer_reviews.author: ShaveIce

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: been throwing them for a week bouncing off all kinds of stuff. no clue bout knife throwing, sometimes we get something too hard for them to stick,but doesn't stop us from giving it more effort! We still haven't messed one up yet, sometimes the very point gets lil bent, we just bend it back and keep throwing
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stitcher on the handle.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great for beginning throwers. Good weight and balance. Unfortunately, I sliced my hand on one when throwing (finger 4 stitches), and my left palm when pulling it from a stump. Make sure you dremel or hone the edges of these things. The handles are dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners learning to throw knives
customer_reviews.text: My children (age 9-19) and I love competing against each other while learning to throw these knives. They have great points that have held up well. We throw at a large slice of tree trunk hanging from a tripod stand my son built. No broken or bent tips. We have sharpened them occasionally. Also, we spray painted the handles yellow to make them easier to find, when we miss, or they bounce off and land in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Mama to 9

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: These are spectacular knives! I have practiced with them a ton since buying them and they make throwing for beginners a very easy process. I actually chose these ones specifically after doing some research online and all signs pointed back to them. Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Thompson

customer_reviews.title: great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for something play with when I'm bored. I love them! I have never thrown knives before and i found these to be perfectly balanced. Once you get the correct distance down it's easy to hit your target. Now my son says his dad has ninja skills!
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: These throwing knives are pretty nice for the price. Nicely balanced, they throw well. They have a little heft to them and make a nice thud when thrown properly. My son was wanting them, and he has put them through the ringer, and they still are in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: T. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to knife throwing but these were a great hit at the campground. The whole family enjoyed them. They have held up very well since then also. Well balanced and very sturdy. I recommend this set to the novice and professional alike.
customer_reviews.author: Bartok

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KNIVES
customer_reviews.text: these knives are balanced well and great for a beginner to learn how they like to throw their knives. They've held up really well considering they've hit may things other than my target! The tips and sharpness are still perfect even after hundreds of throws.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Good for starting out
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be a good product, the only issue is more an alert in general. If the knives hit each other they can create a nick that makes a small barb of very sharp steel. Sliced my finger when this happened so now I inspect them after throwing each time to ensure this doesnt happen again. I keep a small file with the kit to smooth over any such nicks. Overall though -great value and its been fun using them to learn. Tips seem to hold up well
customer_reviews.author: Donald R Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Father & Son Activity!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son & I to start throwing in the back yard. Great weight and balance; has taken huge hits and no dings yet. My 8 year old picked up 1/2 spin & full spin throws right off the bat. We love them!
customer_reviews.author: Backwoods Mister

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and well balanced
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these in Afghanistan for a few months now and have never had an issue with them. I'm throwing them at a regular sheet of plywood and the tips are still as new. I leave them outside in the courtyard at work and there's a total of 5 of us that throw them. Very sturdy and well balanced. Definitely plan to purchase more once I'm back home.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Great set of knives
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner who never threw a knife in my life, these are great.. they are very durable as I have hit everything but the target.. I have already thrown them at least 1000 times and not a ding on them. After another few hundred times of practicing, I finally hit my target. Will definitely be buying these or Smith and Wesson brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: NOT Durable
customer_reviews.text: Durability is garbage. Does the Smith and Wesson brand a disservice to sell these. The metal is like clay. Tips bent beyond useable state after hitting a rock once. I've had plenty of throwing knives in my life and these were among the least durable.
customer_reviews.author: thedudeabides1001

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all I did not expect them to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Not happy at all I did not expect them to be sharp but I did expect a sharp point so they would at least stick In a 3/4 thick plywood. But they are not sharp at all would not stay stuck even when I stuck them in from right in front of it with out throwing them . As hard as I could stick it . My pocket knife stuck better then these knives
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Super Slick!!
customer_reviews.text: This is basically the most badass throwing knives you could get for the price. Not only is S&W a great firearm company, but they also make awesome throwing knives! Spread the word, tell your friends!!! The knife holster also hooks to your belt, which is really badass.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: beware burs
customer_reviews.text: I like these knives. I'm new to this, but these knives felt really good in the hand, the size and shape are great for getting the feel for throwing and getting a set of six is great. My only issue thus far is that after a few collisions with each other, I got some bent tips (easy to straighten back out) and worse, some sharp edged burs along the handles. I noticed these too late, to prevent a cut across my palm and a few metal shards stuck in my finger. I was able to file these down, but the other set of knives i have don't have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Knifes
customer_reviews.text: Bought one set found the knifes very easy to throw, even the kids had some luck so we bought a second set. Don't throw these at your trees just build a simple backboard out of pine 2" x 6" scrap "Look out squirrels."
customer_reviews.author: TeamHowards

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality! LOVE These. Very Balanced Throwing Knives. A+ Only sharp at point Which is Good!- In which it should be. //Throwing knife should be: Sharp only on tip of throwing knife to penetrate through receiving object. Worry free of accidentally slicing hand with throwing knives. Quality Blades. GREAT Sturdy Sheath
customer_reviews.author: James Tazzetto

customer_reviews.title: Solid knives
customer_reviews.text: Thick solid knives. Sharp tip but the blades are safe to handle. Nice weight. Will stick in 3/4" plywood at 15 feet with about 1/2" depth. Threw it at OSB and it went through after about a dozen throws. Excellent balance.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Daxton

customer_reviews.title: They work like top notch, sell them for $50
customer_reviews.text: Wow these are good , nice Quality definite good for the money, They are not cheap but they are the Real McCoy.. If you wanna get in the knife throwing these are the ones, It's nice to have more than just 3 knives so u can work on Hitting in target.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Frank

customer_reviews.title: The Hands Down Best for Learning.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow. My first set of knives. And I can say that I made a good choice. I used these along with YouTube to learn to throw. I was throwing at 6 feet o. day 2. Excellent knives. Nice and balanced. Easy to lean with. I can go on and on .
customer_reviews.author: Tracy T

customer_reviews.title: Good for just starting.
customer_reviews.text: My son and i have wanted throwing knifes for a while. We finally got these and were happy with our choice. After watching a lot of video we got the hang of it and have had a lot of mother son bonding throwing knifes at out make shift target. They have held up great with all the abuse we have put them through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the real deal... Great quality, balanced weight, easy to learn...
customer_reviews.text: I learned, in just a few minutes, how to throw these knives. I won't lie, I thought they were just a gimmick at 1st, but after about 10 minutes of practice, I saw just how good that I could get if I just practice.
customer_reviews.author: OMAR

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality
customer_reviews.text: Smith and Wesson is usually a brand associated with quality. This must not include their knives. As you can see from the photo, none of these knives are even the same length so thusly none have the same balance point etc. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Onery Devil

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for the price
customer_reviews.text: Adequate. Quality material, great price, the weight of the knives are evenly balanced for throwing. The grip on the handle is adequate; however I'd like to see this knife with a leather type wrap on the handle to provide better control.
customer_reviews.author: C.Noble

customer_reviews.title: Not balanced well
customer_reviews.text: I mean for the price yeah whatever but realistically you canT feel the revolutions. it’s not waited well at all it’s basically it’s like throwing a butter knife and since it’s very small that adds more difficulty.
customer_reviews.author: rocci berrini

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They had fairly good weight, but just didn't have what it takes. Plus one of the tips chipped from just hitting the wood on about the first or second throw.
customer_reviews.author: Fishing Show

customer_reviews.title: Smith and Wesson Throwing Knives
customer_reviews.text: These throwing knives are great! Not sure why people were having issues with them breaking? Maybe they were throwing at a target that was too hard, who knows. But anyway, definitely would buy again and will recommend them to all my friends! Thanks Smith and Wesson for another great product!
customer_reviews.author: Clay Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works well with a little modification
customer_reviews.text: During the pandemic, I want to find a sport that exercise my arm and shoulder so my frozen shoulder won't get worse. I bought these to learn throwing knife. The edges of the handle are a bit sharp, so I dull them with a file. After that, they work well.
customer_reviews.author: CHI-JEN YANG

customer_reviews.title: Handle edges sharper than blade
customer_reviews.text: Only the very point is sharp which is ok but not happy with the feel of them cause the handle edges and cutouts are too sharp. They should have been smoothed over. Would not buy again and don't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: NYC GUY

customer_reviews.title: Tips bent after only a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because Smith and Wesson throwing knives came highly recommended. But after a few uses the tips started to bend. Would not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Starling

customer_reviews.title: Great Knives
customer_reviews.text: Build extremely strong and are extremely sharp. Perfectly balanced, it took very little time adjusting to them. From S&W, another great product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward N.

customer_reviews.title: These knives are well balancedd
customer_reviews.text: i like the balance. Great throwing knives.l use them for playing around and throwing them into my trees. I dislike nothing,every thing about them is fine. I dont throw the enough to get very good with them.but I still have lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good practice knives. Not professional.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these knives to see if I'd enjoy throwing knives. I knew they wouldn't be too notch. I got them earlier than expected. I threw them at wood when I practiced and they did stick! It only uses a point. It is not sharp like a blade but they are fairly well balanced. They are not a perfect knife by all means, but for what you pay for them, it's a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: I'm a rookie thrower and my throwing skills have only gotten better with these
customer_reviews.text: These knives exceeded my standards! I'm a rookie thrower and my throwing skills have only gotten better with these. At first the weight took some time to get used to, but they have withstood everything! Even the concrete wall behind my target stand with no chipping or breaking of the tips. Smith & Wesson is an amazing brand and I'm 100% impressed with the longevity of these knives. Definitely recommend no matter what skill level you are!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great balance, strong.
customer_reviews.text: Great balance, strong. If fit with a swivel hinge and a crow feather, you can plant one 4" in someone gut & stop em long enough to finish them off with a 8" blade. good blood gutter as well. takes about 1000 practice throws to get it down perfect at 20 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Rick and Sirius the Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very good throwing knives. I'm super pumped about these hefty 8 inch throwers. God thank you. Lol. Seriously these are perfect for good recreation. Very durable and forgiving knives. Come with a decent point too. Love them
customer_reviews.author: gave

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner set
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for the Mrs. for a gift. She likes them. She sharpens them often and cares for them as you should. Take care of these, and they'll last you.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: I like the heavy weight and balance in these bad boys
customer_reviews.text: Very nice indeed!! Nice weight and balance. Hope they're not in a habit of getting sold out because I'm fixin on placing another order.
customer_reviews.author: Casey R. Dennison

customer_reviews.title: Smith & Wesson SWTK8CP
customer_reviews.text: These were my first set of throwing knives, they are awesome. I threw these knives for weeks eventually they started to break, I contacted the distributor and they said send them in and they would be replaced at no charge, I had to include $6.95 for shipping. If you are looking for a starter set to develop you throwing technique these knives will take an amazing amount of punishment.
customer_reviews.author: ronald gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Love these knives.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect set...right price. Well balanced. Highly recommended addition to any knife throwers collection. The stainless makes them much easier to find in the grass too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Nice knives !
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t use them Yet . The weight of the knives and the carrying case for the knives is good ! They are sharp . My friend and I dropped it onto his porch with out throwing it and it stuck perfectly on the wood !
customer_reviews.author: Hero

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the along with others for my family to throw in the back yard. These are quality with good points. 9 times out of 10 these are the knives everyone grabs.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heavy duty, I think their a little heavy for beginners, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: idk about durability.
customer_reviews.text: great knives, great weight, great rotation. but after an hour I've already had one tip snap off. and I'm throwing into a very soft wood board, sprayed down to soften it up even more. could have been a fluke, but still a lil disappointing. amazing otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: trevor

customer_reviews.title: Unbalanced, Chips easy and cuts finger, Breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: The balance of the knife is weird and to the blade but also more in the middle which makes them very hard to throw straight and the side chip easily which cuts your finger if your using a fedin grip or finnish. And after using them for a while this one just decided it was going to snap in half. Come on S&W 😒
customer_reviews.author: Justin Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Nice knives, great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice shiny knives. They stick into the target. My son wanted to start throwing knives and these seem to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F Gillis

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beginner so I;m not exactly sure how to rate if they're good for or made for beginners. They seem great for anyone. Very durable and I'm having a lot of fun with them!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: The items were very professionally packaged and the tips were sharp but the edges weren't and I wasn't aware they wouldn't be. Issues at the airport also had them sitting in my shampoo for nearly 24 hours so they've already began to start rusting. Not mad about the whole ordeal but I'm sad that they've already had to be put up in my dresser never to have a chance to be showcased.
customer_reviews.author: Deshawn Goodman

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: these r really fun to throw, fairly durable for the price, tips bend but easy fixable
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ochsenbein

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my son and I
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these throwing knives. He came to me asking if there were lessons for throwing knives. I didn’t know of any so we got the set of throwing knives and watched some you tube vids and now he is just shy of ninja status. Fur for sure
customer_reviews.author: M. Gregg

customer_reviews.title: good for the money
customer_reviews.text: a little small for me but kids love them. tips have bent on a couple of knifes probably from hitting some knots,but straightened right out. I had to grind edge of handle because knifes were hitting each other and shaving bits of metal and getting in my hands. but for the price and 6 knifes they are very good for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: linus

customer_reviews.title: Good for begginers
customer_reviews.text: Works well and good for beginners. Already bent the tip of one but that’s a user error. (I hit a rock) you pay a fair price for 6 knives plus a sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Fun to throw and a nice weight
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner knives. They will dent if you catch a rock so check the area.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Bishop

customer_reviews.title: like someone thought to try them out
customer_reviews.text: Some little scratches on the knives, like someone thought to try them out, or drop them a lot. Also, a little machine oil still on the knives, get all down in the sheath pouches. Good after cleaning. Same length, good weight, not for shaving.
customer_reviews.author: Jon McAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SWEET THROWING KNIVES!
customer_reviews.text: CAN'T BEAT IT FOR THE PRICE... FUN FOR ME AND THE KIDS. I TAKE AN APPLE AND PUT IT ON MY 3 YEAR OLD'S HEAD... I HAVE GOTTEN SO ACCURATE, THAT I CAN HIT THE TOP 1/4 OF IT, 99 OUT OF 100 THROWS! AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect gift,thank you all and Amazon is a great system of delivery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent condition really works perfect. The weight is on the tip of the knives so good for practice
customer_reviews.author: Ferid Gabrie Jr

customer_reviews.title: Durable, balanced, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length and weight for someone learning how to throw knives. After hundreds of throws, the tips finally needed resharpening. More misses than sticks into a hard wood target and they never bent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: davidgotitright

customer_reviews.title: These are nice throwing knifes.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice. I purchased these for my wife and she is in love with them (even though I can throw them better lol). If you need a great set of throwing knifes, these are the ones for you.
customer_reviews.author: aerobear109

customer_reviews.title: You suck
customer_reviews.text: I bought cheaper products and they stick so much better, the smith and western do not even come sharp! The stick is the worst!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Billy D.

customer_reviews.title: A good set of knives overall but its hard to get ...
customer_reviews.text: A good set of knives overall but its hard to get overall information on this knife. It's a really good blade if you can take care of it (if you don't know how to it'll break in a few days if constantly used) but like I put it before there isn't really any information on how to take care of a knife of this design. That's the only bad part also for anyone looking for the ultimate blade there isn't one all blades break after being constantly used especially if you're looking for swords or throwing knives.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia S.

customer_reviews.title: Good throwing set
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand how people have broken these, I have tried to break them just to see how it was done but I have yet to snap one of them in half. They worked well for beginner knives, they get the job done. :) Would recommend if you’re interested in the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: S&W Throwing Knives - a great deal
customer_reviews.text: the throwing knives are what I ordered and the price again was right! I could not go wrong unless they were overpriced, in which they were not. the price was a tad lower due to the knives being used, they looked brand new. no complaints, great job Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ted Az

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Pointed, Throws Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love these knives! I see some have had them break, but that is expected, after all, your throwing it! I put down some Harbor Freight Cushioned Floor Mats to help protect them when they fall, so far has worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Broke a blade after using it for two days
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed at breaking a blade after only two days use. Even built a target board out of 3x3x5.5 posts.—revised because customer support replaced broken blade in two weeks. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Not even worth the low price. The knives came with splinters on the edges, which cut my hand. I wore down the edges, but they continue getting splinters.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Wow these are not good
customer_reviews.text: Man these things aren't good at all. Really heavy but the weight is not good for the length. Unless you throw them really hard. They aren't going to stick. Maybe you would have to sharpen a ton of material off to make them slimmer on the end. Either way. Not happen with my purchase, really want to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Seem nice but came with rust on them out of the package
customer_reviews.text: Knives are heavy duty, I can't speak much to their strength yet but they all came with rust on the back. Not a large amount, but still more than you would like for something brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Soya

customer_reviews.title: Great throwing knives
customer_reviews.text: These knives are will constructed and well balanced. So far I've had no issues with quality or breakage. Practice makes perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Best Christmas present I purchased this year! Bought for my husband is in love with this set!! Durability is great and well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: heather atterbury

customer_reviews.title: Son approved
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a gift to my son for Christmas. He was really stoked and couldn't wait to set up a target range. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Warme

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used them yet but they came as described and are very aesthetically pleasing. Pouch is an awesome bonus
customer_reviews.author: Vernecelyn Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good  for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: After one day of throwing one broke. They arrived not sharp.
customer_reviews.author: WI

customer_reviews.title: Great Set of Knives!
customer_reviews.text: Great beginner's set of throwing knives. Great balance, solid hold. Recommend throwing tip first vs. handle at about 15ft away. Also be careful: one of them broke in half against a rock. I ordered a replacement and they shipped an entirely new set almost over night! Definitely bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Makoto I.

customer_reviews.title: Great knives,  stick almost every time.
customer_reviews.text: These are my first attempt at learning to throw and they are very easy to use and quite forgiving of my mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: 2 broken knives very fast
customer_reviews.text: I loved these knives when i first got them 2 days ago. Threw them for about 4 hours worth of time and 2 just snapped in half on back to back throws. Ive been throwing them at an ash tree trunk that i carved into but have really liked them otherwise. (they were my first set of knives)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Like
customer_reviews.text: I still am not very good with these but my teen grandkids are getting very good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: First Set of Throwing Knives
customer_reviews.text: Not that I would know, but these were recommended by several websites and several of us are using them to learn. They seem well balanced and sized. Though we already have begun to show some wear because out backstop is near a concrete curb, I have no doubt that they will prove to be durable and any dings easily ground out when needed.
customer_reviews.author: jh7

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to throwing this set of knives once I find a large diameter cut log.
customer_reviews.author: davido

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. I havent used myself but boyfriend and kids seem to like them.
customer_reviews.author: Angel McDorman

product_meta.title: Smith & Wesson SWTK8CP Six 8in Stainless Steel Throwing Knives Set with Nylon Belt Sheath
product_meta.description: Smith and Wesson focuses on creating knives that are ready for all situations. Whether you are a knife collector, survivalist or a first responder, you can trust that your S&W knife will be the tool you can rely on in any situation.
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 8 inch (20.3 centimeter) length with an individual weight of 4.7 ounces and an overall weight of 1 pounds 12.2 ounces
Durable: Blade is made of reliable 2Cr13 S.S
Dependable: Quick and easy access with the convenient black, nylon belt sheath that holds all 6 knives
Secure: Have confidence in your throw with these sturdy, well balanced knives
Guaranteed: This product is covered by a limited lifetime warranty. For questions or warranty contact us at customerservice@btibrands.com

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
